contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=<!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Qahir Class Corvette.jpg|300px]] --> |Ship caption=Qahir Al Amwaj, in Portsmouth Naval Base }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Builders=[[Vosper Thornycroft]], UK |Operators={{flag|Oman}} |Class before= |Class after= |Subclasses= |Built range= |In commission range= |Total ships building= |Total ships planned=2 |Total ships completed=2 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active= |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= <ref>http://flot.com/news/navy/index.php?ELEMENT_ID=60726</ref> |Ship class=[[Corvette]] |Ship type= |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement=1,450 tonnes |Ship tons burthen= |Ship length={{convert|83.70|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|11.50|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draught={{convert|3.50|m|ft|0|abbr=on}} |Ship hold depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship ramps= |Ship ice class= |Ship power= |Ship propulsion=2 shafts, 4× Crossley-SEMP-Pielstck 16PA6 V280 STC Diesels 32,000 bhp (24,000 kW) |Ship sail plan= |Ship speed=25 knots |Ship range=5,500 nmi (10,200 km; 6,300 mi) at 12 kn (22 km/h; 14 mph) |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship troops= |Ship complement= |Ship complement=60 |Ship time to activate= |Ship sensors=1× Kelvin-Hughes Type 1007, Navigation radar 1× HSA MW-08 3D air/surface search radar 1× Thomson-CSF Castor IIJ MRR Fire control radar 1× HSA STING radar/optical fire control |Ship EW= |Ship armament=8× MM40 Block 2 [[Exocet]] anti-ship missiles 1× octuple [[Crotale]] NG SAM launcher (16 missiles) 1× [[Otobreda 76 mm]] 62 Super Rapid gun 2× Oerlikon GAM-BO1 20mm cannon | |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft=Helipad |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The ''Oman Qahir'' class was built by [[Vosper Thornycroft]] in the [[United Kingdom]]<ref name="Todd p32">Todd and Lindberg 1996, p. 32.</ref> as a [[stealth ship|stealthy]] version of their [[Mark 9 corvette]], utilizing both [[radar]]-absorbent materials in the hull and angled shapes to minimize radar refraction. ==Ships in Class== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Ship !! Date Launched !! Date Commissioned |- | Qahir Al Amwaj || 21 September 1994<ref>http://www.naval-technology.com/projects/oman/</ref> | 3 September 1996 |- | Al Mua'zzar || 26 September 1995<ref>http://www.worldwarships.com/class/vigilance/al-muazzar/</ref> | 26 November 1996 |- |} ==See also== {{Empty section|date=November 2012}} ==Notes and references== {{reflist}} *{{citation|last=Baker|first=A.D.|title=The Naval Institute Guide to Combat Fleets of the World 1998–1999|publisher=Naval Institute Press|location=Annapolis, Maryland, USA| year=1998|isbn=1-55750-111-4}} *{{citation | last1=Todd | first1=Daniel | last2=Lindberg | first2=Michael | title= Navies and Shipbuilding Industries: The Strained Symbiosis | url=http://books.google.com/?id=he5KL_tWQvMC&pg=PA32&dq=Qahir+Al+Amwaj | publisher = Greenwood Publishing | year = 1996 | isbn = 978-0-275-95310-2}} == External links == * [http://www.naval-technology.com/projects/oman/oman5.html Image] {{DEFAULTSORT:Qahir Al Amwaj}} [[Category:Corvettes of the Royal Navy of Oman]] [[Category:Corvettes of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Southampton-built ships]] [[Category:1996 ships]] [[Category:Active corvettes of Oman]] {{Oman-stub}} {{mil-ship-stub}}
